page.title: 04The A92 Stonehaven Bypass
page.content: Plans for a road that would bypass Stonehaven, therby letting vehicles heading to/from Aberdeen avoid the small town centre with its narrow streets, were put forward as early as 1927. Work did not begin however until 1982. Congestion in the town cene, Allardyce street had reached unacceptable levels. This was mainly due to the expanding oil buisness in Aberdeen. Thus the two year project began, eventually costing 12.85 Million. Starting at Glasslaw farm, it runs in a valley were it passes Beneath the main railway line at Fetteresso. The bypass then runs in abroad sweep to the norh east, crossing the deep gorge of the Cowie Water. The dual carriageway is 8.3km. The excavation involved the removal of over one miilion cubic metres of earth
